reviews.text: had an extra day off and was travelling by Lake George so decided to play golf at the Sagamore. Noticed they had a golf special, room and golf for 2 at $269, this was in mid june. As I am a preferred member, used their reservation line and got an even better price of $209, golf for 2 included. This is a great rate as non hotel guests are charged $130 each to play and hotel guests are charged $115 each. So we basically got the room for free. the front desk upgraded us to a lodge suite, a very nice room with living room, small kitchen with a lake view and great new bed. Bathroom was a little dated but renovated and very workable. The shower was really good. Had a late diinner at the bar in the hotel and the burger was excellent. The golf course is really nice and a lot of fun to play with some great views from the course. My only complaint is that they charge a "resort fee" of $25/day. I hate resort fees. But as a Preferred member, they gave me an $25 credit that negated the resort fee.
reviews.title: a great day of golf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is really nice, and has a good feel inside. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel, I don't like buffets, so we went into Bolton Landings and had a nice normal breakfast in an old diner car. I think it was called Bolton Bean. After golf we had a nice lunch on the water at the Algonquin.
reviews.title: The Sagamore on July 4th - expensive 3 day trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We plan to go back after labor day when the place settles down from the summer. Hopefully we will get the same deal.
reviews.title: If you're in the area, stop in for the breakfast buffet

reviews.text: Great place with lot's of first class facilities: multiple waterfront activities including boating, swimming, outdoor pool, indoor pool, fitness center, rec. center with multiple activities for kids, 5-6 tennis courts, 18-hole golf course and 5-6 pretty good restaurants.
reviews.title: The Only Way To See The Adirondacks- An Adirondacks First Class Adventure to Remember with Excellent Service from the Management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the drawbacks: the rooms in the Inn itself are outrageously expensive and the rooms in the outlying Lodges (where we stayed) are nice but over-priced. We ended up in an upper room with no balcony and no patio sitting area. No place to sit outside. You can get Lodges with very small patios (which I thought I had booked) but at a premium. We paid $500 a day including a breakfast and dinner meal plan for two (2) and also had to pay a mandatory $25/day resort fee (ridiculous) and all alcohol, taxes and tips. Ended up being $1,800 or $600/day. Pretty expensive for a Lodge room with no outdoor space.
reviews.title: Simply Lovely

reviews.text: Lake George is definitely the most beautiful lake in the US. I was in awe staring out at the glassy lake with the gorgeous mountains in the background. Great for boating, hiking, kayaking, fishing, water skiing, camping, or just relaxing.
reviews.title: Peace of Lake George Heaven

reviews.text: Views were beautiful. Room in the lodge was good. Golf course was good, would want more than the caddy shack. Patty at the Pavillion Restaurant was amazing. The front lawn croquet was cute. Pool was very nice on a hot day
reviews.title: Beautiful views

reviews.text: Stayed with my family, 9 total and my aunt and uncle own two units and found it to be plenty of space. The kitchen was a bit dated, but by 2013 they will all be done over. It is obvious that they discourage cooking in the rooms (the stove had only two burners, no steak knives etc). The unit showed minimal wear and tear and included a nice view in the one room.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Price

reviews.text: The pool, beach and grounds were well cared for and the staff are very nice. Plenty of lounge chairs around the pool in a tier like setup. For people 16 and up you can enjoy an indoor quiet pool. I'm 14 and got away with being there though. You can also swim in the lake in select areas.
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery, be careful with rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's the price issue. We went to dinner at La Bella Vita and it was pricey (27 bucks for chicken parm!) and the bill says " 18% service charge added for parties of six or more, gratuity not included." We didn't realize this until after and tipped our waiter and paid the service charge so we ended up double tipping him so watch out.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to the Sagamore and my husband and I will definitely be back again next summer. Our children go to sleepaway camp in the Lake George area, and we decided to turn visiting day weekend into a mini-vacation. We opted to stay in the less expensive lodges,which are not far from the main building of the resort (if you ask to be put in Lodge areas 1, 2 or 3). It still isn't cheap, with tax and resort fees, just under $400 a night, but the hotel amenities, great service, and proximity to Lake George make it worth the price. The lodge rooms are very basic, it would have been nice to have a refrigerator in the room to store some drinks, but it was nicely air conditioned and perfectly fine. Even though the hotel has been around forever, they did a fantastic job of updating the main resort, spa, fitness center, and restaurants. They also added a beautiful pool that overlooks the Lake. The food and service by the pool area are very good. I got to the pool late one day, and the only lounge chairs that were left were ones without an umbrella for shade. I asked if there was any possibility of getting an umbrella by my chair, and a pool service person moved a very large umbrella for me over to my chair. It was very nice. They did that for other folks too upon request. My husband and I rented a small speed boat on the property and boated around Lake George for awhile. It was lovely. I had a spa treatment that was very good. I also used their tennis courts, which were well maintained har-tru courts. If you have kids, it is also a nice family vacation spot. There is an enormous Rec Room with mini-golf, a mini-baseball diamond, video games, ping pong, and more. There are multiple restaurants at the Hotel, all of which are lovely but we only ate dinner in one. We ate at the Pavillion which was right on the Pier of the Lake. The view was fantastic and the food and service were good- but not excellent to be honest. They could add a few specials to make it more diverse and interesting.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort in the Lake George Area

reviews.text: All in all, I loved it and will definitely be back next summer for visiting day weekend again. I highly recommend this resort, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here July 6-9 2012 and have to say we were not disappointed! I was a bit worried after reading the mixed reviews but since we were traveling with three other families we decided to give it a try. The only problem we had was at check-in. We stayed in the lodges and when we arrived around 2:00pm and our room was not ready. The other families stayed in the hotel and their rooms were ready. The front desk could not give us time that it would be ready so that was a bit awkward. When we didn't hear anything after about and hour my husband went to the front desk to see what the hold up was. We were given a choice of rooms that were ready at that time and picked lodge five. A little bit of a walk but that was ok.
reviews.title: Def Worth Experiencing This Classic Luxury In An Idyllic Location

reviews.text: The room was wonderful! We stayed in the walk in level lodge. It was one of the renovated rooms and was practically brand new....from the carpets to the granite countertops it was great! Very roomy for a family of four. We had a great view of the lake from our bedroom and the main room. We have two children ages 8 and 13 who slept on the pull out sofa bed.....it was very comfortable. It was great to have a full kitchen for breakfast in the morning. The resort supplies coffee for the K-cup but we had to ask for more when it wasn't replenished the second day, but after that it we had plenty of coffee. We had a nice but small balcony which was relaxing to have morning coffee on and overlook the lake. The bathroom was very roomy and clean. There was a nice walk in shower and separate bathtub. Everything was very clean and new.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great room and we would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Almost, but not quite

reviews.text: I had a lodge suite on a lower level with a lake view. The room was nice -- king bed, large bathroom, kitchen, living room, dining area and patio with rocking chairs. Chocolates were provided nightly for turndown. Some of the furnishings seemed a little older - especially the kitchen appliances. My fridge door didn't quite close. But, it was all very clean. A couple of the lightbulbs weren't working, but not a big deal. The gas fireplace was welcome even though it was May. There were TVs in both living room and the bedroom. The bath included both a bathtub and a separate shower. The shower was pretty big with a glass door. I loved the shower. The suite can be converted into a 2-bedroom suite through the adjacent room that shares a lockable foyer.
reviews.title: Great resort & conference center!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free parking lot nearest my room was taken up by conference displays --- but, I can't complain about that because I was there for the conference. Hopefully, this applied to most of the guests.
reviews.title: First Trip to Lake George & Sagamore and Loved It

reviews.text: The pools were nice. Indoor pool has walls that open up and feels like it's almost outdoors. The pools are in the back of the hotel, leading down to the lake. Since the lake is pretty far down, there are multiple levels with adirondack chair groupings set up. Food and drink were also quite good.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience, with few areas for improvement

reviews.text: This is an excellent resort. The pool is awesome with a great view of the lake. We actually spent more time swimming in Lake George though with has insane water clarity. I've never seen anything like it. It's a gorgeous setting for a very nice hotel. They have an army of staff members who were all very nice and helpful whenever we had need of something. Restaurants at the hotel are good. We got a package that included the buffet breakfast and they had a lot of tasty options. We were there 4 days and we didn't get to try everything. Overall experience was great. I would say if this hotel is in your budget it's well worth it.
reviews.title: Amazing Dinner at The Pavillion

reviews.text: We just came back from a visit to the Sagamore with 2 children, 1 toddler, and 5 adults, and we all had an amazing time. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful, with Lake George as a stunning backdrop. There are a lot of activities for kids including crafts, sports, bonfires, and so much more. This is a very family friendly resort, but is also ideal for a romantic getaway. My stomach usually turns when I hear 'family friendly,' but this resort has done it exactly right. Crafts and activities for kids, but not in a way that compromises the sophistication of the hotel. We tried all the restaurants (i think there were 7, with one off the grounds), and we LOVED all of them. The food is excellent.
reviews.title: Fabulous resort
